content: urban shells scarf katherine crombie abeautifulramble blogspot com 300m of dk weight yarn 4 5mm crochet hook tapestry needle for sewing in the ends measurements 4 25inches 11cm wide and 52 5inches 133cm long stitches used us terminology chain chain slip_stitch slip_stitch single_crochet single_crochet double crochet double_crochet triple crochet treble_crochet back post double_crochet bpdc * and front post double crochet fpdc * special stitches shell shell 2dc ch1 2dc in same stitch or space note a bpdc gets worked when the wrong side ws of the scarf is facing you fpdc gets worked when the right side rs of the scarf is facing you st stands for stitch m skip means skip and chsp means chain space i e space created by chaining such as in the center of the shell i used 300 yards of a dk weight yarn but the pattern will easily lend itself to other yarn weights instructions chain 26 multiple of 5 plus 1 chain for turning row 1 single_crochet in second chain from hook single_crochet in each chain across turn 25sc row 2 ch4 treble_crochet in same st skip 3 st slip_stitch ch4 treble_crochet in same st repeat across row ending with a slip_stitch in the last st do not turn instead rotate 180 6 scallops row 3 ch2 shell shell in first st *skip 2 st double_crochet in next st skip 2 st shell in next st repeat from * turn row 4 ch2 shell in chsp of previous shell *skip 2 st bpdc around double_crochet from previous row skip 2 st shell in next st repeat from * turn row 5 ch2 shell in chsp of previous shell *skip 2 st fpdc around bpdc from previous row skip 2 st shell in next st repeat from * turn repeat row 4 and 5 until scarf is desired length or the yarn has nearly run out scallop edging so that both ends match row 1 ws should be facing you ch2 2sc in chsp *ch1 bpdc around fpdc from the previous row chain 1 3sc in chsp of shell from previous row repeat from * until second last shell ch1 2sc in shell turn 25sc row 2 ch1 single_crochet in top of each st to the end of the row turn 25sc row 3 ch4 treble_crochet in same st skip 3 st slip_stitch ch4 treble_crochet in same st repeat across row ending with a slip_stitch in the last st 6 scallops fasten_off yarn and weave in ends stand back and admire then wrap it around your neck and go look in a mirror the copyright of this pattern remains with myself it is provided free for personal use only the pattern
